intro: Gisekia burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's gisekia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming during the warmer months. Gisekia burchellii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
